üé® {uteals} Package Hexagon Design Contest

Source: _HEXAGON_DESIGN_CONTEST.md

We‚Äôre looking for the perfect hexagon logo for the uteals package! Help us create a visual identity that represents our utilities and extensions for the teal framework.

About uteals

The uteals package provides decorators, transformators, and utility functions to enhance the teal package ecosystem. The package includes:

  • Decorators: ggplot_decorator(), patchwork_plot_decorator(), ‚Ä¶
  • Transformators: merge_levels_transformator(), or_filtering_transformator(), ‚Ä¶
  • Module Access Management wrappers: extract_modules_to_yaml(), keep_by_label(), remove_by_label()

Design Guidelines

Required Elements

  • Package name: ‚Äúuteals‚Äù
  • Hexagon format (standard R package hex sticker)
  • Colors that complement the teal package palette:
    • Light blue: #E4EFFF
    • Medium blue: #80BAFF
    • Dark blue: #4A90E2
    • Teal green: #008C72

Design Inspiration

  • Utilities theme: Tools, gears, building blocks
  • Teal connection: Reference to the teal bird or teal package aesthetic
  • Professional: Suitable for pharmaceutical/clinical research context

How to Submit

  1. Fork this repository
  2. Create your hexagon design as PNG (recommended size: 181x209 pixels)
  3. Add your design to the hex_designs/ folder with filename: uteals_hex_[yourname].png
  4. Include a brief description in hex_designs/README.md explaining your design concept
  5. Submit a pull request with title: ‚ÄúHexagon design submission: [Your Design Name]‚Äù

Submission Requirements

  • Original artwork (no copyrighted elements)
  • PNG format, transparent background
  • High resolution (minimum 181x209 pixels)
  • Follows R package hex sticker conventions

Timeline

  • Submission deadline: 14 December 2025
  • Community voting: 15 - 19 December 2025
  • Winner announcement: 21 December 2025

Recognition

  • Winner‚Äôs design becomes the official uteals package logo
  • Credit in package documentation and README
  • Recognition in package release notes

Questions?

Open an issue with the hexagon-contest label or contact the maintainers.

This contest is part of the PHUSE ‚ÄúTeal Enhancements for Cross-Industry Adoption‚Äù working group initiative.
